legalnotice.title: Feedback
legalnotice.para: To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the Services Administration Tool or this manual, follow the directions in the GNOME Feedback Page.

abstract.para: The Services Administration Tool allows you to specify which services will be started during the system boot process.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The Services Administration Tool allows you to specify which services will be started during the system boot process.

sect1.title: Getting started
sect1.para: You can start Services Administration Tool in the following ways:
When you start Services Administration Tool, you will be prompted for the administrator password. This is necessary because the changes done with this tool will affect the whole system.
After entering the administrator password, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows Services Administration Tool main window.

sect1.para: The Services Administration Tool main window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: This is a list of the main services installed in the system. The tickbox indicates whether the service is active.

sect2.title: To enable or disable a service at boot time
sect2.para: Enable or disable the tickbox beside the service in the services list.
